channel.title: Building-exhibits on Introduction to mapping and spatial methods for the humanities
channel.description: Recent content in Building-exhibits on Introduction to mapping and spatial methods for the humanities

item.title: Building exhibits
item.description: Overview Several online exhibit-building tools incorporate spatial data. In this module, we’ll review some of the most common examples used in digital humanities projects (circa 2017). Neatline This Omeka add-on was designed to build place-based narratives that are well-integrated with Omeka collections. It is maintained by the Scholarsâ€™ Lab at the University of Virginia Library. Example: Georges E. Michaud : Souvenirs d’un grand homme by Lysanne Brazeau, Sophie Cayer and Ariane Pelletier as part of the ISI6354 Cultural Heritage Resources course taught by Jada Watson.
